Quotes from why we should all be feminists by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie

Author: Aadya Garg April 6,2021
Feminism

‚ÄúThe person more qualified to lead is not the physically stronger person. It is the more intelligent, the more knowledgeable, the more creative, more innovative.‚Äù

‚Äúwe have evolved but our idea of gender have not evolved very much.‚Äù

‚Äúwhy by the way, do those hotels not focus on the demand for sex workers instead of on the ostensible supply.‚Äù

‚ÄúEach time they ignore me I feel invisible, I feel upset. I want to tell them that I am just as human as the Man‚Äù

‚Äú These are little things, but sometimes it is the little things that sting the most‚Äù

‚ÄúI am also hopeful, because I believe deeply in the ability of human beings to remake themselves for the better‚Äù

‚ÄúI am Angry, We should all be Angry. Anger has a long history of bringing about a positive change‚Äù

‚ÄúWe spend too much time teaching girls to worry about what boys think of them. But the reverse is not the case‚Äù

‚Äú We spend too much time telling girls that they cannot be Angry or Aggressive or Tough, which is bad enough but then we turn around and either praise or excuse men for the same reasons‚Äù

‚ÄúWe should begin to dream about and plan for a different world. A fairer world. A world of happier men and happier woman who are truer to themselves.‚Äù

‚Äú We stifle the humanity of boys, we define masculinity in a very narrow way. Masculinity is a hard,small cage, and we put boys inside this cage.‚Äù

‚Äú we teach boys to be afraid of fear, of weakness of vulnerability. we teach them to mask their true selves, because they have to be, a hard man‚Äù
